definition: to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: I'm serious. I avoided her question.
sentences.chinese: 我语塞，支支吾吾地回避了她的问题。

sentences.english: Don't hum and haw, but air your views.
sentences.chinese: 别支支吾吾的，快亮明你的观点。

sentences.english: Around this figure the West, for four decades, prevaricated.
sentences.chinese: 四十年以来，西方对于这个人物，一直支支吾吾。

sentences.english: She shuffled , trying to keep it as a secret.
sentences.chinese: 她支支吾吾，想使那件事保密。

sentences.english: He hesitated constantly in telling his story.
sentences.chinese: 他讲述个人经历时总是支支吾吾。

sentences.english: He began to hem and haw when I asked about his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我一问到他的妻子，他支支吾吾回答不出来了。

sentences.english: Three years later, the investigation has stalled.
sentences.chinese: 三年过去了，调查行动仍是支支吾吾。

sentences.english: He hemmed and hawed around and didn't tell me what I wanted to know.
sentences.chinese: 他支支吾吾地兜圈子，就是不肯说出我要知道的问题。

sentences.english: The boy faltered when the policeman demanded his name.
sentences.chinese: 在警察要求男孩说出他的姓名时，他支支吾吾。

sentences.english: He hummed and hawed but finally told me the truth.
sentences.chinese: 他先是支支吾吾，可最后还是跟我说了实话。

sentences.english: But Takeru hems and haws , as his memory of the incident on the bridge keeps shifting.
sentences.chinese: 但是健支支吾吾，他在桥上的记忆也开始动摇。

definition: to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
to respond evasively or vaguely/to elude/to stall
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to show signs of reluctance or embarrassment
to be at a loss for words/speechless
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
to want to say sth but then hesitate
